definition: lit. find a stage, put on a comedy (idiom); to join in the fun/to play along according to local conditions
to meet by chance/to come across/(of a calendar event) to come along/(of an event) to fall on (a particular day)/to fawn upon
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

sentences.english: Some people regard friendship as a game.
sentences.chinese: 有的人把交朋友当作是逢场作戏。
我有两个选择，逢场作戏或直言相告。

sentences.english: We of this trade know too well that we are only playing a game.
sentences.chinese: 咱们搞这一行的只不外是逢场作戏嘛。

sentences.english: Find amusement when the occasion arises and sincerity, in the heart forever have clear dividing line.
sentences.chinese: 逢场作戏和真心厮守，在心里永远有明显的分界线。

sentences.english: Find amusement when the occasion arises and sincerity, always have a clear dividing line in the heart.
sentences.chinese: 逢场作戏和真心厮守，在心里永远有明显的分界线。

sentences.english: Know he is just find amusement when the occasion arises.
sentences.chinese: 也清楚他不过是逢场作戏。

sentences.english: He smokes occasionally, and just for fun.
Or maybe they're just faking it as part of a long-term plan to regain the White House front door key.
sentences.chinese: 又或者他们只是逢场作戏，为的是重新入主白宫。

definition: to act in a play/to put on a play
a couple in a short-lived, improper relationship
to bow down to everything sb says or does/to act submissively in order to ingratiate oneself
to rival sb for the affection of a man or woman/to be jealous of a rival in a love affair
to fondle the flowers and trample the grass (idiom)/to womanize/to frequent brothels/to sow one's wild oats
